Description: Lower body sherd of early Chian pottery patterned chalice; white slip; interior: glazed brown; exterior: dilute lines frame handle zone which contains double saw-edged metope band between groups of vertical strokes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (pp. 31-2, no .A. 1a, pl. 1, no. 1)
van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (pl. 1)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 232, no. 68, pl. 6, no. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0350) (phase 2)
